result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry W Bacinett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerry W Bacinett

records.addlTxt: from Clerk to Defendant re: CAA bill
Attorney fees in the amount of $766.76 for Attorney Melissa Petersen.
Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

9:53 AM case called. Attorney Trenton John Piltz in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jerry W Bacinett in court with Attorney Melissa M. Petersen. Agreement has been reached. State moved to amend Count 1:Disorderly Conduct Domestic Abuse to County Ordinance Disorderly Conduct Domestic Abuse. Court accepts motion.

Defendant pleas No Contest to amended Count 1:County Ordinance Disorderly Conduct Domestic Abuse. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty.

Court orders costs.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Melissa Petersen at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $50 beginning 09/16/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
10:20 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jerry W Bacinett in court without counsel. State mentions there is no offer at this time. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 08/15/2022 at 3:15 PM
Hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No contact with D.B. or E.W.
Defendant allowed to retrieve belongings one time if accompanied by a law enforcement officer. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.

11:12 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jerry W Bacinett appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Kate Cook. 
Waives reading of the complaint. Defendant not eligible for SPD representation. Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 6-29-22 at 3:00 PM. 
Return to court: 7-26-22 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
No contact with D.B. or E.W.
Defendant allowed to retrieve belongings one time if accompanied by a law enforcement officer. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
